column1: Team Cuellar had a wonderful time at the Laredo Crime Stoppers Menudo Bowl. A really great event for such a great cause! https://t.co/uagXOoXIKM

I am proud to have helped secure $1.7 billion to expand student loan and education programs for low-income students and Hispanic student populations. We must give our students the resources to pay for college and help them land good-paying jobs. https://t.co/BjhoaNCLhQ

Congressman Cuellar had a perfect 100% attendance record in 2019. Yes you read that right 100%. Congressman Cuellar did not miss 1 vote. He is doing what you elected him to do the work! https://t.co/9jj7PUTvpP

Our nation's farmers are the backbone of our country. When re-elected I will continue to fight for South Texas agriculture and make sure it has a strong voice in the halls of Congress. https://t.co/PFJpV8lPyn

Always great to see new businesses opening up in the community! Congrats to Margarita Govea and Jose Cantu pictured here with former Laredo Mayor Raul Salinas in launching Phoenix Bookstore in downtown Laredo offering huge selection of books! Best wishes for much success! https://t.co/V06A5KHjXW

Congratulations to Annette Alvarado Roxanne Garcia Bo Jesse Thorpe and Mario Gonzalez on being sworn-in today as deputies with the Webb County Sheriff’s Office. Sheriff Martin Cuellar and myself couldn’t be more proud! May God watch over them and keep them safe. https://t.co/a1DwZzmHk5

Spending Christmas Eve with Dr. Henry Carranza President of L.O.V.E.D (Laredo Organized Volunteers for the Elderly and Disadvantaged) and volunteers with  @Area Health Education Center delivering bags of food to families. Great work being done by the parent volunteers over at Dr. Henry Cuellar Elementary School as they spent the day collecting jackets and blankets to give to kids who attend the school. Happy I was able to help with a donation. Have a wonderful weekend! #giving https://t.co/Iu8L82NERV

Team Cuellar officially opens campaign HQ among hundreds of supporters and volunteers!! Thank you to everyone who made it out! If you'd like to join our team go here: https://t.co/i5unPbnI0O #teamcuellar #2020 https://t.co/XCtZFnKaW7

I’d like to thank my colleagues for their support in passing USMCA as well as our neighbors to the south—Mexico—for working with us in developing the language that is now a win-win for both our nation’s economies. 🇺🇸🇲🇽🇨🇦  #USMCA #USA #Mexico #Canada https://t.co/sQmoVCsYzb

USMCA Passes! Yesterday was a great day for the economy of our nation our state of Texas and my congressional district as the USMCA was overwhelmingly approved by the House. In fact all 36 Texas members voted in favor! 🇺🇸🇲🇽🇨🇦 https://t.co/RZXtxJIoSW

USMCA = Jobs Jobs Jobs!  On the House Floor today asking my colleagues for their support of the USMCA (NAFTA 2.0) that would bring many economical and environmental benefits to my District!! #USMCA #jobs https://t.co/O9EsEHW0M5

Proud to announce I have been endorsed by 114 elected officials from all of the district’s 9 counties. This endorsement list is truly unprecedented. It shows the impact we are having and the consensus that experience and effectiveness matter. https://t.co/f8yB6HB1pK

Excited to announce the signing of the final #USMCA deal today that will bring an estimated increase in trade to my district of 5-10% a year proposed job creation of more than 200000 and a projected increase of the GDP by nearly $70 billion! #trade  🇨🇦🇺🇸🇲🇽 https://t.co/ozj7f3i0gL

Supporting economic growth in my district is a key priority which is why this additional $374580 for the Texas Rural Cooperative Center in the Rio Grande Valley to help increase the capacity of small-scale Latina agricultural producers is key for this area. #utrgv #rgv https://t.co/sL2TF1IgrR

I'd like to thank my colleagues in Congress for joining me in voting for the passage of the Voting Rights Advancement Act which restores the promises of the Voting Rights Act of 1965 upholds the integrity of our democracy and increases transparency in our elections. #vote https://t.co/3hnv0Nn0ts

My colleagues and I continue working on passing the US/Mexican/Canada Agreement (USMCA)--important legislation for our district. This will create more jobs through the international trade industry and support a healthy economy in the U.S. Texas and our district. https://t.co/OMlb0VAXmZ

https://t.co/WyvhvQYHtm  Today Laredo shines bright as the crown of Miss Texas Teen USA returns home with the crowning  of Miss Anissa Mendez at the pageant held in Houston yesterday. Very proud of Anissa and all the young ladies who did an outstanding job representing Laredo!

A symbol of civil rights for all Ms. Rosa Parks stood her ground on this day 64 years ago on December 1 1955 refusing to give up her bus seat to a white passenger. Today I honor her memory by pledging to fight for equality among all minority and diverse groups.  #RosaParks https://t.co/5ncQLx9RRC

https://t.co/9gt7f3Zk62  Small businesses create 3 out of 4 local jobs and for every $1 spent there 67 cents stays in the local economy. On this Small Business Saturday (11/29) join me in supporting local jobs by supporting  entrepreneurs throughout the 28th district!

Happy Veterans Day! Today we honor the men and women who are willing to put their lives on the line for millions of Americans through their service in our armed forces. Please know how grateful we are to each and every one of you. 🇺🇸

Sending lots of gratitude appreciation and respect to all U.S. Marines as they celebrate their 244th birthday today! That's 244 years of serving our country with honor valor and pride. You make us proud! #semperfi #happybirthdaymarines #244yearsofcourage https://t.co/XqDOeGCSFE

With respect honor and gratitude thank you for your service your sacrifice and your love of country. Happy Veterans Day! 🇺🇸 #veterans #veteransday #laredo #sanantonio #mcallen #rgv #henrycuellar2020 https://t.co/mXSHUZZnok

Reflecting back on the many educational initiatives Graciela Ramirez and I tackled together during her tenure as Superintendent of Laredo ISD reminds me of how devoted she was to making sure her students  were afforded every opportunity. She will be greatly missed. 🙏🏻✝️ https://t.co/vqQefbnmnO
My deepest condolences to the family of Oscar Silva Jr. who passed away over the weekend. As a well-respected member of law enforcement in Encinal his absence will truly leave a void. 🙏🏻✝️

Our hearts and prayers go out to the families of the U.S. women and children killed today in Mexico. As a husband and father it is unfathomable to think of what their families must be going through. We pray and hope that their faith keeps them strong in these difficult times.

Have you voted today? This is one of many precincts in the district where you'll find election officials on hand ready to help you cast your ballot--10 constitutional amendments on the line! Polls remain open until 7pm. Let your voice be heard--vote today! #vote #texas https://t.co/2NHGUSZ2IF

We are now investing $50 million dollars each year into much needed carbon-capture technology to combat climate change in a way that also creates affordable energy and stimulates our economy without cutting jobs. #henrycuellar2020 #laredo #mcallen #rgv #sanantonio #zapata https://t.co/JnaG3T65uy

https://t.co/OjkwBzc0JL I created the Texas Grant program in 1997 as a member of the Texas Legislature to enable financially challenged students access to a college degree. Help me continue to help other deserving students by donating to my re-election campaign. https://t.co/RqKKb4aEGb

On the anniversary of 9/11 I’m mourning all those who lost their lives and remembering the sacrifice of our first responders. After the events of that day we came together as a nation and faced the challenge ahead of us. We must always remember that we’re stronger together. https://t.co/dXV0otq0pi

We told you the outside special interests were coming to take away local jobs. Elizabeth Warren and our opponent share an agenda that would kill over 108000 jobs in our region. I'm fighting back. Will you join me?

I want to wish everyone a happy Labor Day. On days like today we remember the sacrifices of generations before us who fought for policies that benefit everyone - such as fair pay paid leave and higher wages. In Congress I will continue to fight for American workers.
No matter who’s in the room I’ll always fight for smart solutions to our border problem. https://t.co/fZqktpBZhN

I’m proud to be recognized as one of the most bipartisan members of Congress. It’s the job of elected officials to find the right solutions to our nation’s problems not Republican or Democratic solutions. Congress works best when Congress works together. https://t.co/SfzbCd3S8Y

As the child of migrant workers education opened doors to me that allowed me to serve my community in Congress. 20 years ago I was honored to have an elementary school in the Laredo community named after me. It was my pleasure to meet with the teachers and students last week.

The Green New Deal would kill jobs for hard-working Texans. In Webb County alone 8000 people would lose their jobs and 1 billion in payroll would be lost overnight. Our schools and quality of living would be devastated. Policies crafted by New York PACs won’t work for Texas.

As a member of the House Committee on Appropriations I have secured and increased funds for the Pell Grant the Federal TRIO Programs and the Gaining Early Awareness and Readiness for Undergraduate Programs.   Going to college shouldn’t mean going into debt.

Higher education should be accessible to our students regardless of how much money their parents make. I’m proud to say that the TEXAS Grant that I helped create is now the largest grant program in the state and has helped thousands of students get a college education.

we need to strengthen our relationship and reaffirm our shared values with these countries. As a delegation we will work together to create strategies to improve security economic development and governance in these countries.

Last week I was pleased to join Speaker Pelosi and my House colleagues in visiting the Northern Triangle of Central America - namely Guatemala Honduras and El Salvador. To adequately address the challenges El Salvador Honduras and Guatemala are facing

This weekend is #taxfreeweekend in Texas. I helped create this annual holiday so families could feel some economic relief during their back to school shopping. As we look towards the school year I hope everyone can spend some quality time with their families this weekend! https://t.co/AuSMg0uh0l

Earlier this year I was proud to vote for the Dream and Promise Act which protects young people who were brought to our country as children from facing deportation. It's a step towards comprehensive immigration reform and the Senate should take it up and pass it right away.
Now the Senate must bring these important bills up for a vote and do their part to strengthen our gun laws - in a way that protects both the Second Amendment and innocent lives.

That’s why I introduced and successfully passed the Fix NICS Act of 2017 which helps increase communication between agencies to prevent guns from being purchased by those who intend to do harm. Earlier this year I also voted in favor of the Bipartisan Background Check Act.
Anyone who knows me understands that I will always protect lawful responsible gun ownership. But they also know I have zero tolerance for irresponsible gun ownership.
The tragedy in El Paso is unthinkable. As a parent and a lifelong Texan my heart is with the people of one of our state’s greatest cities.

I am one of eight children born to migrant workers in my hometown of Laredo Texas. Only in America can the child of migrant workers go on to serve in Congress. I’m excited to be running for re-election in 2020 and I hope you’ll join me on the journey. https://t.co/XXTKtGQYw4
